title.value: Особенности роста, продуктивность и экономическая эффективность возделывания бобово-злаковых агрофитоценозов в звене зеленого и сырьевого конвейеров
Growth peculiarities, productivity and economic efficiency of cereal-leguminous agrophytocenoses cultivation in a link of green forage and roughage chains

journal.title: Arable Farming and Breeding in Belarus : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Bobko, V.I., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). Scientific and Practical Center for  Arable Farming

abstract.value: In course of the four-year research there was studied the effect of sowing and harvesting terms on growth dynamics, productivity and economic effectiveness of cultivation of annual leguminous and leguminous-cereal mixtures for green fodder and silage. The research was realized in the conditions of the Republic of Belarus on the experimental field of Scientific and Practical Center for Arable Farming on sod-podzolic light loamy soil in 2006-2009. As a result of realized research it was revealed that from early to later sowing dates, legumes and cereals responded by accelerating linear growth and plant weight formation. It was found that the most productive crop in pure and mixed crops used in the flowering stage of leguminous crop of the green forage chain was blue lupine (Lupinus angustifolius) for green fodder cv. Gulliver, which provided the yield of feed units of 57.8-67.2 c per 1 ha, protein yield of 10.5-11.4 c per 1 ha in pure crops, and 63.0-72.3 c per 1 ha and 8.7-11.3 c per 1 ha in mixed crops, respectively, depending on sowing term. By this index, Gulliver was significantly superior to other annual forage crops. Other studied crops of green forage and roughage chains were also cost-effective for cattle production manufacture.
